comments.body:
@potiuk This line is failing the backport tests "saying cannot import" -- any idea why?

https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/8895/checks?check_run_id=716706159#step:6:6573

very interesting.

I've never seen it before but seems like bowler does not like the file:
```
Bowler exception during transform of ./airflow/providers/amazon/aws/example_dags/example_s3_bucket.py: Transforms generated invalid CST for ./airflow/providers/amazon/aws/example_dags/example_s3_bucket.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/bowler/tool.py", line 145, in processed_file
    new_tree = self.driver.parse_string(new_text)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/fissix/pgen2/driver.py", line 102, in parse_string
    return self.parse_tokens(tokens, debug)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/fissix/pgen2/driver.py", line 71, in parse_tokens
    if p.addtoken(type, value, (prefix, start)):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/fissix/pgen2/parse.py", line 164, in addtoken
    raise ParseError("bad input", type, value, context)
fissix.pgen2.parse.ParseError: bad input: type=12, value=',', context=('', (56, 36))

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:
```

@turbaszek -> have you seen anything like that before?

I could  not find anything strange in the file. My hunch is that it was a transient error. Bowler uses multi-processing heavily so this might be result of lack of memory which might lead us to add some limitations to it. I am testing it locally to see if that could be a transient issue.
Nope. Same for me :) ... That's an interesting one
OK. I know. We are adding python_context as extra parameter of PythonOperator call and we end up with double coma:

```
     add_keys_to_bucket = PythonOperator(
         task_id="s3_bucket_dag_add_keys_to_bucket",
-        python_callable=upload_keys
+        python_callable=upload_keys,,
+        provide_context=True
     )
```


For now you can remove coma but I will fix it in our refactor code. @randr97

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +18,22 @@
from airflow.models.dag import DAG
from airflow.operators.python import PythonOperator
from airflow.providers.amazon.aws.hooks.s3 import S3Hook
from airflow.providers.amazon.aws.operators.s3_bucket import S3CreateBucketOperator, S3DeleteBucketOperator
